alert.note: Alert for Apache (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 29 at 2:25PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Locations along and just east of Highway 191 in Apache County, including Ganado. * WHEN...Until 430 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Water flowing over roadways will create slick paved roads and muddy unpaved roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 223 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.25 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Wide Ruin Wash, Burnt Piqon Wash, Fish Wash, Pueblo Colorado Wash and Kinlichee Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ganado and Navajo Reservation. - This includes the following highways... Highway 191 between mile markers 404 and 411. State Route 264 between mile markers 447 and 460. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding of washes and creeks will occur, some dirt roads will become muddy and impassable. Paved roads and underpasses could become flooded as well. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
